Data Access Disclosure

This app requires access to SMS messages and phone-related information to function properly.

üîç What Information We Access:

  • SMS MESSAGES: Full content of your SMS messages.
  • YOUR PHONE NUMBER(S): The phone number(s) associated with your device\'s SIM card(s).
  • PHONE NUMBERS FROM SMS: Phone numbers contained within your SMS messages.

üì± How We Use This Information (LOCALLY ON DEVICE):

  • YOUR PHONE NUMBER: We collect and use your device\'s phone number only to display it in the app interface for SIM card selection. This number is processed locally and not transmitted.
  • PHONE NUMBERS FROM SMS: We extract phone numbers from SMS messages to allow you to copy them easily. This extraction happens locally.
  • SMS CONTENT FOR OTP: We analyze SMS text to automatically detect and copy OTP codes to your clipboard. This analysis happens locally.

üö´ What We DO NOT Do With Your Data:

  • We do NOT TRANSMIT or UPLOAD your SMS messages, phone numbers, or any message content to any server.
  • We do NOT STORE your SMS data or phone numbers on external servers.
  • We do NOT SHARE your personal data with third parties.

‚úÖ Key Guarantee:

All data processing occurs exclusively on your device (on-device). Your SMS messages and phone numbers never leave your device. Internet access is used only for sending MMS and processing Google Play purchases.

üîë Required Permissions Explained:

  • READ_SMS: To access SMS for OTP copying and phone number extraction (local processing only).
  • READ_PHONE_STATE: To collect and display your device\'s phone number for SIM selection (local use only).

By continuing, you acknowledge that:

  1. This app collects your device\'s phone number for local display
  2. This app accesses SMS messages for local OTP and phone number extraction
  3. None of this data is transmitted from your device

Android has restricted access to SMS features for this app. To continue:

1. Tap "OK" to open App Settings.
2. Tap the three dots (‚ãÆ) in the top right corner.
3. Select "Allow restricted settings".
4. Return to the app and try again.
